DOC.brief_summary: This study is a comparison of open surgery versus an endoscopic approach in condylar neck fractures; it will look at functional outcome, cosmetic outcome and patient satisfaction.
DOC.brief_title: Open Versus Endoscopic Surgery of Craniomaxillofacial (CMF) Condylar Neck Fractures
DOC.detailed_description: The primary outcome measure is functional outcome based on the Helkimo dysfunction index.
DOC.criteria: Adult patient > 18 years Unilateral or bilateral fracture of the condylar neck Inclination of the condyle > 30% Severe dislocation Severe pain upon palpation/movement Eligible for open reduction and internal fixation of the fracture Amenable to endoscopic as well as open surgery High or intracapsular condylar neck fracture Very low fractures that can be reduced intraorally CMF malfunctioning Drug or alcohol abuse General or local conditions that adversely affect bone physiology Physical or mental incapacity to sign informed consent
